We have removed an estimated two million Argulus eggs, (fish louse), from a fishery in #Norfolk in the last two years.

Argulus can cause distress and in some cases death to the fish.  

This thread explains how you can spot them and what to do when you doüëá #Fishing #Anglers https://t.co/W68cRQgwnH
@mentalmapping @qwag @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust @AnglingTrust @thameswater That's brilliant news!

Good fisheries management is essential in combating external pressures like poor water quality, high stock levels and stress that can help #parasites thrive.

There are various ways you can reduce the impact the parasite has on your #fishery but the best options to take depends.. https://t.co/KMKSX92L0n

Fish with louse may stop feeding, become lethargic, lose condition and darken in colour.

Argulus can enter a fishery in various ways - #fish movements offering the biggest risk.
 
Fish should be health checked with screens for the most damaging parasites. #Fishing https://t.co/pjZ3MN8niT
